description:
Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC) - Combatant Training and Integration Centre – Pacific (CTIC(P))
CFB Esquimalt, British Columbia
(with Security Requirements)

Purpose of this Advance Procurement Notice
This is not a bid solicitation. This is an advance notice of a potential contract with anticipated security requirements to provide interested consultants/contractors an opportunity to begin the sponsorship request process for potentially obtaining the required security clearance(s) that are anticipated. Note that there is no guarantee that this contract will proceed or that any security clearance(s) will be granted under the sponsorship process in a timely fashion or otherwise.

Description of the ProjecT and Services
Modified Design Build (MDB) for the design and construction of a new purpose-built Combatant Training and Integration Centre (CTIC).

The Royal Canadian Navy (RCN) is in the midst of a fleet and capability revitalization. The new backbone of the fleet will be the Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC). The future fleet requires sustainable, scalable, and flexible training and operational support infrastructure that can deliver support to balanced CSC capacity and capabilities.

The RCN requires a digitally enabled Combatant Training and Integration Centre (CTIC) in Esquimalt that will aggregate operational support and secure training in a single facility.

The facility will be designed to maximize its re-configurable nature and prioritize collaboration and laboratory workspaces which will be the basis for the future work environment in a digital age.
The RCN, therefore, is seeking assistance to addressing the requirements for the new Combatant Training and Integration Centre’s infrastructure.

Key Features/Requirements

Combines operational support and secure training in a single facility
Digitally enabled training and operational support infrastructure
fast technology cycles, agile capability development, and multi-system integration
Included: Security Requirements







INCLUDED 


BILLETS AND PAPERWORK \r



Universal selection criteria

full_summary:
# Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC) - Combatant Training and Integration Centre (CTICP)
## Tender Preview
* Reference Number: #MX-43072118422
* Solicitation Number: #81933-MDB
* Publication Date: *Mar 22, 2024*
* Tender Closing Date: *May 1, 2024 5:00 PM*

The Royal Canadian Navy (RCN) is seeking a contractor to design and construct a new Combatant Training and Integration Centre (CTIC) in Esquimalt, British Columbia. The centre will support the RCN's fleet and capability revitalisation with a digitally-enabled training and operational support infrastructure.

## Project Overview
The CTIC will aggregate operational support and secure training in a single facility, with a focus on networking and connectivity. The facility will be designed to maximize its re-configurable nature and prioritise collaboration and laboratory workspaces. The centre will comprise four functional areas: a Secure Training Facility, a Maritime Warfare Centre, a Data Management Centre, and a Network Operations Centre.

## Contract Award and Security Requirements
To be eligible for contract award, a consultant/contractor must actively hold a Facility Security Clearance (FSC) at the Secret level at the time of closing. Defence Construction Canada (DCC) will provide sponsorship under the Industrial Security Program (ISP) to support contractors in obtaining the required security clearance.

## Tender Information
* Tender Description: Advance Procurement Notice (APN) for the CTICP project, demonstrating an interest in starting the sponsorship request process for the required security clearance.
* Rough Order of Magnitude (ROM): $180-200 million
* Anticipated Contract Start Date: October 1, 2024

This is not a bid solicitation, but rather a preliminary notice to encourage interested parties to begin the sponsorship request process under DCC's Industrial Security Program (ISP). The announcement does not guarantee the award of the contract due to unforeseen circumstances. 

### Important Links
* Notice URL: [https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2847184267/abstract?language=EN](https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2847184267/abstract?language=EN)
* Documents: Available on [http://www.merx.com](http://www.merx.com)
* Fees: Please see [https://www.merx.com/public/pricing](https://www.merx.com/public/pricing) for more information
